sentences.english: Consider a group of n miners, who have discovered large bars of gold.
sentences.chinese: 考慮找到了大量金條的n個挖礦者。

sentences.english: Mining colored ore seems to improve skill a little faster than normal iron ore.
sentences.chinese: 挖色礦對提高挖礦技能比挖普通礦有更大幫助。

sentences.english: As for mining centralization in general, I still think it's a major problem.
sentences.chinese: 對於挖礦算力的集中，我仍然認爲這是一個大問題。

sentences.english: The miners had starved with cold and hunger on that island for nearly a week.
sentences.chinese: 挖礦的人在小島上又冷又餓地捱了快一個星期。

sentences.english: My stockholders put $6 million into developing a mine in Peru.
sentences.chinese: 我的股東花了6百萬美金，用來在祕魯挖礦。

sentences.english: If there are an odd number of miners, then the core is empty.
sentences.chinese: 如果有奇數個挖礦者，那麼中心爲空。

sentences.english: The digging attribute determines a Duplicant's mining speed.
sentences.chinese: 挖掘能力決定了複製人挖礦的速度。

definition: seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
a legendary tree that sheds coins when shaken/a source of easy money (idiom)
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
